column4: I'm trying to install a tarball and am getting an error during compile. Could not find the gnomeConf.sh file that is generated by gnome-libs install
I've got the build-essential package installed...any ideas?
you need to install the relevant *-dev packages
how do you know what the relevant packages are?
use synaptics to search for them or use apt-cache search in a terminal
I think you need libgnome2-dev in your case but that should give you a clue for any further requirments
how do you know what *dev files I need to fix the error
I'm installing libgnome2-dev metapackage now..I'll see if that will help
D'oh! Nope still getting same error
what is it you are trying to install?
drip
drip 0.9. A DVD ripper
dvdrip?
no, not dvd::rip
ok, just making sure :)
I guess you need to find out from the documentation what it requires to build and then you will need to find the -dev packages.
it's looking for gnomeConfig.sh in /usr/local/lib. Never heard of that file..I'll check the docs again
look at ./configure --help too
well they have an option in there "./configure --without-pic", which I'm using, but still get the error
MrKennie:
drip looks a bit dead to me, last package ubuntu had was in gutsy.
you've had experience with dvd::rip?
yes, it's not bad. There are some good guides on using it.
alright, maybe I'll just give that a try I guess "dvd::rip"
